title: Banquet
summary: A banquet (/ˈbæŋkwɪt/; French: [bɑ̃kɛ]) is a formal large meal or feast,[1] where a number of people consume food together. Banquets are traditionally held to enhance the prestige of a host, or reinforce social bonds among joint contributors. Modern examples of these purposes include a charitable gathering, a ceremony, or a celebration. They often involve speeches in honor of the topic or guest of honour.[2]
